title: The Cold Summer of Fifty Three

sources.title: The Cold Summer of Fifty Three
sources.description:
Anatoli Papanov’s last role.
The postwar period, difficult for the USSR. Summer of 1953. The country is on the eve of major changes, but the news of Lavrentiy Beria’s arrest hasn’t reached all remote corners of the country yet. In a remote village in the Russian North, intelligent Kopalych and self-contained Luzga, two political exiles, scuffle. Of the locals, only Shura, daughter of the mute cook Lydia, makes small talk with Luzga. Meanwhile, about one million criminals, amnestied by the March decree of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR, are walking around the country. One of these gangs is attacking the village...

Year of production: 1987

Directed by: Alexander Proshkin
Written by: Edgar Dubrovsky
Director of photography: Boris Brozhovsky
Music: Vladimir Martynov
Production designer: Valery Filippov
Starring: Anatoli Papanov, Valery Priemykhov, Nina Usatova, Zoya Buryak, Vladimir Golovin, Sergey Vlasov, Yury Kuznetsov

The film was digitally restored by Mosfilm Cinema Concern
Find out more: https://cg.mosfilm.ru/en
Subscribe to our YouTube channel, and be sure to click the bell so that you won’t miss the best Soviet movies!
